title: Is Talon slated for a rework anytime soon?
body:
He's been repeatedly nerfed several times, just because of Incredibly strong his kit, is since it has no counter play except for buying a pink ward, but even then he can still jump and kill you but you can see it. His kit is terribly designed and just making no sense. It's just  a super burst champion that gives you zero reaction time to do anything as you'll be dead the moment he jumps on you since all his damage is instant. Talon's one of my favorite champions and I hate no being able to play him because of all the nerfs he received because of his badly designed kit.

I'd love to see Riot give him a Fiora size rework, I think theres  a lot of potential to make him a Great, Fun and Interesting Champion to play.

replies.body: We do think Talon could do with a bit of work at some point, aimed at making him more distinct from other assassins and improving counterplay available for some enemies. Overall though there are quite a lot of other characters that need the work more, so he's not a rework priority.

Some counterplay is already present in his kit because of the fact that two of his spells have their damage split into halves (W and R) This is one of the reasons why I believe Talon to be a well designed champion despite his age. I'm really proud of his designer.

Of course if you guys can think of something better that allows him to remain effective while still being fun to play against, then I'd love to see the result. I'm just saying that the way his kit is designed with his split and segmented damage has made it stand the test of time (and counterplay) rather decently.

Talon pulls off his full burst combo in roughly 2 seconds. Normally at the end of his combo he will use r->w to instantly get both parts of his ult damage off. There's not a terrible amount of counterplay to it.

The fact that he no longer has a silence, combined with the fact that his primary damaging spells are segmented, provide you with many ways to dodge his damage, such as blinks, projectile blocks, and on-demand untargetability. A decent Zed or a decent Fizz will always beat a Talon that is higher skilled than them, because of the many ways they have to dodge his damage especially due to the fact that he no longer has a silence. 

Talon's designer was a genius when he made the segmented damage in his W and R, there's no disagreeing with that. 

Fun fact: It doesn't matter much anymore, but his Rake's travel time was always 1 second long, and it always took 0.25 seconds to cast, meaning back when he had his silence you *always* had 0.25 seconds to dodge the second half of his W and R damage. Now you have as much freedom as you want.

Think of all the mid laners in game that are assassin now imaging all those who are also ad. Zed is the only one I can think to mention in just about every regard Zed does every thing that Talon does but safer. His upfront bust is done in about 2-4 second after that he got nothing to let him back out. Any ap mid laner can and will simply build a Zhonyas and cancel most if not all his burst. In addition unlike other mid lane assassin he has no viable way out If he engages wrong. Team fight are also a massive problem for him because of the reason listed before. A good Talon can't overcome the fact that his kit while strong is a bit out dated if you think he's in a good spot you don't know the champion. Saying that talon has no counter play is simple untrue because so many of his mid lane rivals are very effective at stopping him from snowballing only a select few are unable to had him in lane and those who can't often are more utility based. also his w range isn't that large a poke heavy mage will simply poke him out of lane if he can't all in before he's too low. The simple fact his kit might have been good for a while but with this current state of the game he isn't a smart pick if you play him it's because you want to not because your team need you too. I love Talon but his kit simply isn't justifying him to be picked more often so how about let just give him the same amount of buff the juggernauts got a see what happens cause that's how you balance out people with strong but outdated kits right?

He can burst at rengar levels of speed with no notice at all, rengars exclamation mark at least gives warning, talons stealth has no such thing, his lane ganks are insane burst in a tiny time window, so cast times or not, reaction times are also a thing. 
That and 1.2k crits with Q - .-

With Talon's projectiles, you can't get away from them EXCEPT for flashing away, excluding champion-specific abilities that include either untargetability or mobility, which only further increases the mobility creep in the game.

His W has a wide enough hitbox and a slow, so if you get hit by the first, you are guaranteed to get hit by the second if you don't flash out of it. The wide hitbox also guarantees that you will take damage if you are in range, which is guaranteed with his E.

His ultimate comes out instantaneously. Because Talon can pull it back almost immediately, is already in melee range, and will likely slow you with at least one of the two abilities he has with a slow, the second hit is guaranteed.

How do you get out of them? Flash out. It's that simple. Except it's not because Flash has a much higher cooldown than Talon's burst combo. Or you can counterpick him with a champion that has mobility or untargettability to escape his burst, but that's not healthy for the game because the game shouldn't be decided at champion select.

Don't be in range of it. Not exactly a huge range on his w. People must realize that Tomb of Insomnia brings up a valid point; Talon does have counter play against him, and many. Talon has few counter play against others.

Riot's official guidance on how to play against Talon, in champ descriptions:

"Talon has no sustain in lane, so poke and harrass to suppress his growth." Very true. Talon has nothing to rely on other than his trusty health potions. He cannot even safely farm, and has to face the many auto attacks from the enemy champ. Not to mention the skills he has to dodge. His weak early game is his breaking point, much like Akali or Azir or say.

Talon's rake is very heavy in mana costs, and he gains little from it. Vapora Dark has it covered that Talon is forced to use W only for farming, pre 6. It is a pain to play against almost any champ that is not melee.

Talon ults and stealths! So waht? Pop a pink ward or do the red scanner trinket! Talon is revealed! CC him, kill him, he's as weak as a minion in terms of durability (not exaggerating here).

I am very shocked that many people in this post are still. STILL. yelling to nerf Talon. 

He just got his silence removed, for Talon's sake, the one edge he had against many mages.

A silence that lasts one. One. second.

Keep in mind, that Talon has received multiple nerfs to his Bonus AD ratio and his dmg in his W and R. Also keep in mind that Talon's E's dmg amp has not been activated until S3, where Riot shockingly discovered was never in action (ha. classic Riot). Now S4, S5, the appearance of trinkets make it very easy for any champ to reveal Talon's stealth, his only means of escape.

Some people here talk about how other champs' counter play to Talon is flash. Well guess what, Talon's counter play to escape/outplay is flash.

AND NOW. with the removal of silence, Talon has no means of attacking or holding his enemy, and can only see them escape. Talon is weak on his own. Talon is a weakling.

But LoL is not a game of 1 v 5. It is a team game. The TEAM will create situations ideal for Talon. They will create the best angle for his skills, will take out enemy's exhaust so Talon can go in, will create Talon's roaming angles for ganks...

If a silence-less Talon, compounding with his numerous dmg nerfs he already received, still manages to kill you in game, I can only say that there is nothing wrong with Talon, but there is something wrong with what YOU and YOUR TEAM is doing in the game. Are you allowing Talon to split push, when he is as strong in SP as Master Yi or Sivir? Are you not using pink wards or red scanners? Are you ignoring the fact that Talon is mia, and just ignores that?

Talon is all about timing now. That's all he's got. Riot and you childish haters have took away his silence, cut his dmg in half. The only thing every good Talon out there looking for is a decent timing to charge in and unleash the combo. AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. You should all know that this is compulsory. Because even a level 18 Talon will only have as much as 2000 health with 80 armor and 60 MR, which any. Any same-grown ADC or APC mage can shred him to parts with their full combo/ AutoAttacks. Not to mention bruisers or Tanks. He's weak in terms of durability, that's why Talon cannot afford to be hit, thus his combo needs to be as short as possible, like the "2 seconds" some childish guy whined about, because if he cannot kill the enemy in that TWO SECONDS, he'd be the one who's dead.

For some thoughts, much like Tomb of Insomnia said, Talon's 2 trademark skills/dmg is split in 2 parts, both. To make the bursts healthier, he could have the projectiles slowed down, or have them return to Talon after a longer time, so he too can become like Zed to have a "healthy burst" (classic Rito. full grown Zed can ALSO kill you in 2 seconds, not considering the Ult).

I write this on a mobile in my college class, because I felt empathy for Tomb of Insomnia who got beaten and downvoted by the haters for speaking true words. You people who downvoted should feel bad.

Right now, he stands as a bit of a problem through virtue of being an assassin tuned for being an assassin (ie. he can jump on a squishy and delete them without breaking his stride), yet most of his damage output is AoE (Rake and Ult)--effectively making him an assassin that kills your carry while bursting the rest of your team down because they happened to be nearby.

I think a good step in the right direction could be to turn his AoE from an AoE assassin tool, to something that actively inhibits his assassination power if he's trying to take on a big cluster of enemies. For example, giving Q and R the treatment Gragas's old dash had, where the damage is evenly split among all units hit, or having Q function similarly to Zed's Q (dealing greatly reduced damage to enemies beyond the first), having blades from Q and R only deal damage once on the way out and once on the way back. Honestly, anything that gives him some interesting weaknesses to allow for equally interesting strengths rather than the whole "either he bursts you alone, or you and your entire team" situation he has now.
